title: Dow struggles for direction as investors get nervous about Europe and trade
text:
New York (CNN Business) The Dow and US stock market were hovering near the unchanged level Monday following weaker-than-expected economic data in Europe and renewed fears about the trade war.

Investors are still coming to grips with the latest developments on the US-China trade front, after a Chinese delegation canceled visits to midwestern farms on Friday

Dow INDU S&P 500 SPX Nasdaq Composite COMP Thewas hovering around the unchanged level Monday, most recently up 14 points, or 0.1%. Thewas flat and theis 0.1%.

The European purchasing managers index for September put a damper on expectations for the eurozone economy. The eurozone composite PMI came in at 50.4 — still growing, yet below expectations. The manufacturing PMI showed a worse-than-expected contraction.

In Germany, Europe's biggest economy, the manufacturing sector contracted too. While the services sector continues to expand, it is faring worse than expected.

Read More
description: The Dow and US stock market were hovering near the unchanged level Monday following weaker-than-expected economic data in Europe and renewed fears about the trade war.
